subtitle: agenda for change
title: The Obama administration and the Americas
subjects: United States -- Foreign relations -- Latin America
Latin America -- Foreign relations -- United States
by_statement: Abraham F. Lowenthal, Theodore J. Piccone, and Laurence Whitehead.

description.value: "Argues that the Obama administration should focus early and strategically on Latin America because of its impact on issues from energy, narcotics, and immigration to trade and jobs. Contributors emphasize case-by-case, sophisticated, and multilateral approaches to dealing with such hard cases as Bolivia, Colombia, Cuba, Haiti, Mexico, and Venezuela"--Provided by publisher.
